title: How to Make Vegetable Terrine

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF.
steps.description: Line a loaf pan with parchment paper, or use a silicone loaf pan. Boil the kettle for the pan water.

steps.headline: Make a roux.
steps.description: Pour the butter, flour and milk or stock into a saucepan. Add the seasonings. Heat gently and stir constantly to form the roux.

steps.headline: Blend in the 3 eggs, one by one.
Add the vegetable puree or pulp.
steps.description: Mix through. Remove from the heat.

steps.headline: Spoon the whole mixture into the prepared loaf pan.
Pour the hot water into the pan that will sit around the loaf pan.
steps.description: Add the loaf pan in the center.

steps.headline: Carefully place the whole arrangement into the oven to cook.
Remove from the oven.
steps.description: Let stand for 5 minutes, then remove from the pan and place on a serving platter.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: This dish can be served hot or cold. If serving cold, keep in the refrigerator, covered, until needed. If serving whole on the table, provide diners with a slicing knife and spatula to transfer the slices to their plates.

text: Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF. Line a loaf pan with parchment paper, or use a silicone loaf pan. Boil the kettle for the pan water. Make a roux. Pour the butter, flour and milk or stock into a saucepan. Add the seasonings. Heat gently and stir constantly to form the roux. Blend in the 3 eggs, one by one. Mix well. Add the vegetable puree or pulp. Mix through. Remove from the heat. Spoon the whole mixture into the prepared loaf pan.  Pour the hot water into the pan that will sit around the loaf pan. Add the loaf pan in the center. Carefully place the whole arrangement into the oven to cook. Cook for 45 minutes at 180ºC/350ºF. Remove from the oven. Let stand for 5 minutes, then remove from the pan and place on a serving platter. Serve. This dish can be served hot or cold. If serving cold, keep in the refrigerator, covered, until needed. If serving whole on the table, provide diners with a slicing knife and spatula to transfer the slices to their plates.
